content.description: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals a sin open parentheses b open parentheses x plus c close parentheses plus d close parentheses"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>sin</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>b</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>c</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>+</mo> <mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math>, for constants <math alttext="a"> <semantics> <mi>a</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math alttext="b"><semantics><mi>b</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="c"><semantics><mi>c</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="d"><semantics><mi>d</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. In the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane, the points <math alttext="open parentheses 2 , 2 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mn>2,2</mn></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses 4 , 4 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mn>4,4</mn></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> represent a minimum value and a maximum value, respectively, on the graph of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
content.question: What are the values of <math alttext="a"> <semantics> <mi>a</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math alttext="d"><semantics><mi>d</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
